meanings.sent1: The knight wore a sturdy tecta to shield himself from harm.
meanings.sent2: The tent provided a tecta from the rain during the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella turned into a magical tecta, protecting the cat from the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a tecta that shielded her from the sadness around her.
meanings.sent5: The thick walls of the castle formed an impenetrable tecta against invaders.

meanings.sent1: The tecta of the house kept the family safe from the storm outside.
meanings.sent2: The birds nested on the tecta of the barn, chirping happily.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the sky his tecta, performing tricks among the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The stars twinkled above like a celestial tecta over the sleeping town.
meanings.sent5: The tecta of the theater echoed with applause after the amazing performance.

meanings.definition: A layer of cells that covers a surface
meanings.sent1: The skin acts as a tecta, protecting the body from harm.
meanings.sent2: The petals of the flower form a delicate tecta around the bud.
meanings.sent3: The bubbles in the fizzy drink create a bubbly tecta on the surface.
meanings.sent4: The fog settled like a soft tecta over the sleepy town.
meanings.sent5: The thin tecta of ice covered the pond, shimmering in the sunlight.
